onblur.description: Fires the moment that the element loses focus

onchange.description: Fires the moment when the value of the element is changed

oncontextmenu.description: Script to be run when a context menu is triggered

onfocus.description: Fires the moment when the element gets focus

oninput.description: Script to be run when an element gets user input

oninvalid.description: Script to be run when an element is invalid

onreset.description: Fires when the Reset button in a form is clicked

onsearch.description: Fires when the user writes something in a search field (for <input="search">)

onselect.description: Fires after some text has been selected in an element

onsubmit.description: Fires when a form is submitted

onkeydown.description: Fires when a user is pressing a key

onkeypress.description: Fires when a user presses a key

onkeyup.description: Fires when a user releases a key

onclick.description: Fires on a mouse click on the element

ondblclick.description: Fires on a mouse double-click on the element

onmousedown.description: Fires when a mouse button is pressed down on an element

onmousemove.description: Fires when the mouse pointer is moving while it is over an element

onmouseout.description: Fires when the mouse pointer moves out of an element

onmouseover.description: Fires when the mouse pointer moves over an element

onmouseup.description: Fires when a mouse button is released over an element

onmousewheel.description: Deprecated. Use the onwheel attribute instead

onwheel.description: Fires when the mouse wheel rolls up or down over an element

ondrag.description: The event occurs when an element is being dragged

ondragend.description: The event occurs when the user has finished dragging an element

ondragenter.description: The event occurs when the dragged element enters the drop target

ondragleave.description: The event occurs when the dragged element leaves the drop target

ondragover.description: The event occurs when the dragged element is over the drop target

ondragstart.description: The event occurs when the user starts to drag an element

ondrop.description: The event occurs when the dragged element is dropped on the drop target

oncopy.description: Fires when the user copies the content of an element

oncut.description: Fires when the user cuts the content of an element

onpaste.description: Fires when the user pastes some content in an element

onabort.description: Script to be run on abort

oncanplay.description: Script to be run when a file is ready to start playing (when it has buffered enough to begin)

oncanplaythrough.description: Script to be run when a file can be played all the way to the end without pausing for buffering

oncuechange.description: Script to be run when the cue changes in a <track> element

ondurationchange.description: Script to be run when the length of the media changes

onemptied.description: Script to be run when something bad happens and the file is suddenly unavailable (like unexpectedly disconnects)

onended.description: Script to be run when the media has reach the end (a useful event for messages like "thanks for listening")

onerror.description: Script to be run when an error occurs when the file is being loaded

onloadeddata.description: Script to be run when media data is loaded

onloadedmetadata.description: Script to be run when meta data (like dimensions and duration) are loaded

onloadstart.description: Script to be run just as the file begins to load before anything is actually loaded

onpause.description: Script to be run when the media is paused either by the user or programmatically

onplay.description: Script to be run when the media is ready to start playing

onplaying.description: Script to be run when the media actually has started playing

onprogress.description: Script to be run when the browser is in the process of getting the media data

onratechange.description: Script to be run each time the playback rate changes (like when a user switches to a slow motion or fast forward mode)

onseeked.description: Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to false indicating that seeking has ended

onseeking.description: Script to be run when the seeking attribute is set to true indicating that seeking is active

onstalled.description: Script to be run when the browser is unable to fetch the media data for whatever reason

onsuspend.description: Script to be run when fetching the media data is stopped before it is completely loaded for whatever reason

ontimeupdate.description: Script to be run when the playing position has changed (like when the user fast forwards to a different point in the media)

onvolumechange.description: Script to be run each time the volume is changed which (includes setting the volume to "mute")

onwaiting.description: Script to be run when the media has paused but is expected to resume (like when the media pauses to buffer more data)

ontouchcancel.description: The event occurs when the touch is interrupted

ontouchend.description: The event occurs when a finger is removed from a touch screen

ontouchmove.description: The event occurs when a finger is dragged across the screen

ontouchstart.description: The event occurs when a finger is placed on a touch screen
